column5: Do patients with heart disease have significantly different maximum heart rates compared to patients without heart disease?
Grouping Variable: HeartDisease (0 = No heart disease, 1 = Heart disease present)
Patients without heart disease have significantly higher maximum heart rates (146.64 bpm) compared to patients with heart disease (128.78 bpm).
Effect size: The difference of 17.86 bpm is clinically meaningful.
Clinical significance: Impaired maximum heart rate response may be an indicator of cardiovascular dysfunction in heart disease patients.
